The format of the IP address for the name server {param} is valid.
The format of the IP address for the name server {param} is invalid.
The IP address for the name server {param} is not in a reserved or internal range.
The IP address for the name server {param} is from an internal range.
The IP address for the name server {param} is from a multicast range.
The name server {param} does not respond to recursive queries.
The name server {param} responds to recursive queries.
The name server {param} is not reachable over TCP.
The name server {param} is reachable over TCP.
The format of the domain name is valid.
The domain name is too long.
A label of the domain name is too long: {param}.
A "glue" entry is required for each of the following name servers: {param}.
No "glue" entries are required.
All name servers given are configured for the domain name.
Some of the purported name servers don't have the domain name configured on them: {param}.
All name servers were specified that were found in the DNS for the domain name.
Fewer name servers were specified than could be found in the DNS for the domain name. The following additional name servers were found and should be specified as well: {param}.
The name server {param} fails to respond with a list of name servers for the domain name.
No name servers were specified.
At least two name servers are recommended.
A sufficient number of name servers were specified.
The specified name servers don't have an IPv4 address.
It is recommended that the specified name servers have at least two distinct IPv4 addresses in total. Number of distinct IPv4 addresses: {param}.
The name servers specified have a sufficient number of distinct IPv4 addresses. Number of distinct IPv4 addresses: {param}.
The name of the name server {param} is valid.
The name of the name server {param} is too long.
The name of the name server doesn't start with a letter or digit: {param}.
The name of the name server doesn't end with a letter or digit: {param}.
The name of the name server contains invalid characters: {param}.
The name of the name server contains overly long labels: {param}.
The name server {param} was found in the DNS.
The name server {param} could not be found in the DNS.
The name server {param} points to a CNAME alias.
The name server {param} does not point to a CNAME alias.
The name server {param} fails to respond to a query for a CNAME entry.
All IP addresses found for the name server {param} are configured in the DNS.

Not all IP addresses which are found in our database for this name server could be found in the DNS. The name server's hostmaster should remove the following IP addresses from the database entry: {param}.
All IP addresses found for the name server {param} are configured in the DNS.
Some of the IP addresses found for this name server in the DNS are missing in our database. The name server's hostmaster should add the following IP addresses to the database entry: {param}.
The name server {param} failed to return its own IP address.
All name servers respond authoritatively.
The following name servers fail to respond authoritatively for the domain name: {param}.
The SOA records for all name servers (serial number {param}) are identical.
The following SOA records differ: serial numbers {param}.
Each name server carries exactly one SOA record.
Some name servers carry multiple SOA records. The following name servers carry more than one SOA entry: {param}.
The administrative contact {param} in the SOA record is well-formatted.
The format of the administrative contact {param} in the SOA record is invalid.
The following name servers fail to respond to a query for the SOA record: {param}.
DNSSEC is not enabled.
DNSSEC is configured on your name servers only.
WARNING! DNSSEC is enabled on our name servers only. The domain name will not work! DNSSEC will also have to be configured on the name servers of your domain name.
DNSSEC is enabled.
There were no DNSKEY records found to check the algorithm.
No DNSKEY record has RSAMD5 as its algorithm type.
The following DNSKEY records have an algorithm type of RSAMD5: {param}.
No DNSKEY records could be found to check the protocol.
The protocol of all DNSKEY records is suitable for DNSSEC.
The protocol of the following DNSKEY records is not suitable for DNSSEC: {param}.
There were no DNSKEY records found to check the flags.
The flags of all DNSKEY records are set correctly.
The flags of the following DNSKEY records are not correctly set: {param}.
The signature of the DNSKEY records could not be verified.
The signature of the DNSKEY records is valid.
The signature of the DNSKEY records is invalid.
The signature of the DNSKEY records has expired on {param}.
The signature of the DNSKEY records is only valid starting from {param}.
The name servers are not responding to queries for the DNSKEY record.
The signature of the SOA record could not be verified.
The signature of the SOA record is valid.
The signature of the SOA record is invalid.
The signature of the SOA record has expired on {param}.
The signature of the SOA record is only valid starting from {param}.
The name servers are not responding to queries for the SOA record.
WARNING! None of the DS records points to a valid DNSKEY record on your name servers. The domain name will not work!
For the following DNSKEY records, a matching DS record was found: {param}.
None of the given DS records maps to a DNSSKEY record that is marked as a Secure Entry Point (SEP).
For the following DNSKEY records marked as a Secure Entry Point (SEP), a matching DS record could be found: {param}.
There was no DS record found with SHA1 as the digest type.
The following DS records have a digest type of SHA1: {param}.
The name server {param} is unreachable.
The name server test couldn't be performed.
